sentence.Network_en: They have a siesta during the hottest part of the day.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们会在一天中最炎热的时刻小睡一会儿。

sentence.Network_en: Lots of people were taking a short siesta in the shade.
sentence.Network_cn: 午后很多人在阴凉处小睡.

sentence.Network_en: I went upstairs for my afternoon siesta.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: Spanish, from Latin sexta (hora) 'sixth hour'

entry.tran: (尤指气候炎热国家的)午睡，午休
entry.def: A siesta is a short sleep or rest which you have in the early afternoon, especially in hot countries.

example.ex: They have a siesta during the hottest part of the day.
example.tran: 他们会在一天中最炎热的时刻小睡一会儿。

means.word_mean: 1. a nap in the early afternoon (especially in hot countries)
